intro: Seseli laserpitifolium, commonly known as the narrow-leaved seseli, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in rocky or dry soils and is often found in open habitats such as meadows and slopes. Due to its ornamental value and ecological role, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
